info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 13 at 3:22PM EDT until July 13 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Miami FL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following counties, Broward and Palm Beach.
* WHEN...Until 545 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 320 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated that the thunderstorms have dissipated. However, rainfall amounts of 1 and 3 inches have fallen over this area from the thunderstorms. This amount of water will take sometime to drain away. Therefore, the Flood Advisory will remain in effect until 545 PM EDT this evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Lauderdale, Coral Springs, Pompano Beach, Sunrise, Boca Raton, Deerfield Beach, Tamarac, Margate, Lighthouse Point, Lauderdale-By-The-Sea, Lauderhill, Coconut Creek, Oakland Park, North Lauderdale, Lauderdale Lakes, Parkland, Sea Ranch Lakes, Godfrey Road, Broadview-Pompano Park and Palm Aire. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON
